decision_title: CANONICAL â€” Conditional-Go at Data Readiness Gate (IND-enabling tox evidence packet)
decision_question: At the Data Readiness gate, is the tox dataset complete, traceable, and integrity-checked enough to proceed, with any remaining gaps handled as explicit, owned conditions?

options_considered.description: Proceed now with the current dataset; close minor metadata gaps post-gate under tracked conditions.
pros: Meets gate timeline while preserving governance controls
Gaps are bounded and do not alter primary analyses
cons: Requires strict follow-through and documented closure
Adds monitoring overhead for the next 10 days
options_considered.estimated_impact: On-time gate; low residual risk if conditions are enforced and verified.

options_considered.description: Defer gate by two weeks to close all known gaps prior to decision.
pros: Stronger completeness posture at the moment of decision
cons: Introduces schedule slip and downstream dependency risk
May compress later activities and increase execution risk
options_considered.estimated_impact: Higher immediate confidence; moderate schedule risk with knock-on effects.

decision_outcome.rationale_summary: The evidence packet is sufficient to support the gate decision: dataset lineage is documented, completeness is high, and primary analyses are stable. Two bounded issues remain (Study-03 exposure metadata and late-arrival confirmation). These do not change the gate decision outcome if they are tracked as explicit conditions with named owners, dated closure criteria, and controlled evidence of completion. This decision preserves timeline integrity while maintaining audit-defensible governance through documented conditions and follow-through.
